item.title: Senators’ war with Social Security continues — this time it’s about slashing visits to field offices
item.description: The Social Security Administration reportedly wants to cut the number of visits to field offices in half in fiscal year 2026, with no more than 15 mil...

item.title: OpenAI strikes back in the chatbot race against Google
item.description: A new version of ChatGPT, based on the GPT-5.2, comes as Google has stepped up its game with its rival Gemini offering.

item.title: Americans are facing a growing healthcare crisis — and your medicines are at risk
item.description: To guarantee Americans the medication they need, the U.S. must stop relying on China and India.

item.title: ‘There’s nothing affordable in the Affordable Care Act’ — and people will likely pay even more in 2027 than 2026. Here’s why.
item.description: The future is bleak for Obamacare premiums as people flee higher insurance costs.

item.title: Meta’s stock may actually be an overlooked AI winner. Why bulls say to buy the dip.
item.description: Meta’s AI spending concerns are overblown, according to Morgan Stanley, who sees potential for the stock to surge to $1,000.
